name: Rage
rules: Enter a Rage if you are not wearing Heavy armor.
While raging, you have resistance to bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage.
While raging, you add a Rage damage bonus to Strength-based weapon or Unarmed Strike damage (per class table).
While raging, you have advantage on Strength checks and Strength saving throws.
While raging, you cannot cast spells or maintain concentration.
limits: Uses equal the Rages column for your Barbarian level; regain 1 use on a short rest and all uses on a long rest.
Rage ends at the end of your next turn unless you attack, force a saving throw, or take a bonus action to extend it; a Rage can last up to 10 minutes.
Rage ends early if you don Heavy armor or become Incapacitated.

sourceRef.file: docs/sources/phb2024/04-Character Classes - Player's Handbook - Dungeons & Dragons - Sources - D&D Beyond.pdf

trigger: when you choose to enter a Rage
